content.description:
Neither axis shows tick marks or a scale. The circle is centered at the origin.

The point (1 comma 0) is on the circle and labeled.

An angle labeled theta is shown, beginning at the positive x axis, extending counterclockwise, and with terminal ray in the fourth quadrant.

The terminal ray intersects the circle at point P.

The figure shows a circle centered at the origin with an angle of measure <math alttext="theta"><mi>θ</mi></math> radians in standard position. The terminal ray of the angle intersects the circle at point <math alttext="P"> <mi>P</mi> </math>.
content.question: If <math alttext="tan theta equals negative 3 over 4"> <mi>tan</mi> <mi>θ</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mo>-</mo> <mfrac> <mn>3</mn> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </math>, what is the slope of the line that passes through the origin and <math alttext="P"> <mi>P</mi> </math> ?

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
